result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status hearing on November 15, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

GUILTY - Count 1
GUILTY - Count 2
GUILTY - Count 3
GUILTY - Count 4
Not Guilty - Count 1 (Not Signed)
Not Guilty - Count 2 (Not Signed)
Not Guilty - Count 3 (Not Signed)
Not Guilty - Count 4 (Not Signed)
State's Exhibit #2 - Copy of text messages
State's Exhibit #1 - Certified copies of criminal complaints and bail bonds

8:21 a.m.  DA Gerise Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Alfonso Lopez in court, in custody, with Attorney Michael J Kapelis.
Defendant wishes to proceed with jury trial.  Statement by DA Laspisa regarding prior convictions of defendant.  Atty Kapelis in agreement.  Court makes ruling.  Discussion held regarding bail jumping charges.  Court recess 8:26 a.m.  Court reconvenes 8:47 a.m.  Same appearances.  Statement by Atty Kapelis - defendant will be entering plea of no contest to bail jumping charges.  Defendant agrees.  Court questions defendant.  Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty to bail jumping charges, counts 3 and 4.  DA Laspisa offers exhibit 1.  No objections.  Court received exhibit 1.  DA Laspisa request sequestration order of witnesses.  No objection.  Court so orders.  Court recess 8:52 a.m.  Court reconvenes 9:00 a.m.  Same appearances.  Jurors brought  into courtroom.  Court statement to jurors.  Jurors sworn by Clerk.  Voir dire started.  Peremptory begins.  Peremptory concludes.  Non-selected jurors excused.  Jurors impaneled and sworn by Clerk,  excused to jury room.  Discussion regarding earlier side bar.  Atty Kapelis to discuss with defendant.  Court recess 10:19 a.m.  Court reconvenes 10:37 a.m.  Same appearances.  Discussion held regarding defendant's plea to bail jumping charges. Atty Kapelis states defendant will not plea to bail jumping charges.  Court questions defendant.  Court reads instructions to jurors.  Opening statement by DA Laspisa. Opening statement by Atty Kapelis.  Gracie Rose Cruz sworn, direct by DA Laspisa.  DA Laspisa offers exhibit 2 and moves into evidence.  No objection.  Court receives exhibit 2.  DA Laspisa requests to publish exhibit 2 to jurors.  Objection by Atty Kapelis.  DA Laspisa continues with direct.  Jurors to jury room.  Discussion regarding prior objection by Atty Kapelis.  Court makes ruling on objection.  Court recess 12:00 p.m.  Court reconvenes 1:06 p.m.  Same appearances.  Jurors return to courtroom.  Ms. Cruz returns to stand, still under oath.  Cross exam by Atty Kapelis.  Re-direct by DA Laspisa.  Re-cross by Atty Kapelis.  No re-direct.  Ptlm. Chad Krause sworn, direct by DA Laspisa.  DA Laspisa offers exhibits 2 and 3 and moves into evidence.  No objection.  Court receives exhibits 3 and 4.  DA Laspisa requests to publish exhibits 3 and 4 to jury.  No objections.  Exhibits 3 and 4 published.  DA Laspisa requests to publish exhibit 2 to jury.  Objection by Atty Kapelis.  Court allows publication.  DA Laspisa publishes exhibit 2 to jury. Cross exam by Atty Kapelis.  Re-direct by DA Laspisa.  State rests.  Court questions defendant.  Court questions Atty Kapelis.  Court colloquy of defendant.  Court recess 1:47 p.m.  Court reconvenes 1:56 p.m.  Same appearances.  Atty Kapelis makes motion to dismiss.  Court denies motion.  Jurors return to courtroom.  Alfonso Lopez sworn, direct by Atty Kapelis.  DA Laspisa requests side bar.  Jurors to jury room.  Statement by DA Laspisa.  Response by Atty Kapelis.  Jurors return to courtroom.  Mr. Lopez returns to stand, still under oath.  Cross exam by DA Laspisa.  Re-direct by Atty Kapelis.  No re-cross.  Defense rests.  Jurors to jury room. Court recess 2:30 p.m.  Court reconvenes 2:45 p.m.  Same appearances. Jurors return to courtroom.  Ptlm Chad Krause returns to stand, still under oath.  Rebuttal by DA Laspisa.  Cross exam by Atty Kapelis.  Re-direct by DA Laspisa.  Court goes over jury instructions with counsel.  Court recess 2:57 p.m.  Court reconvenes 3:06 p.m  Same appearances.  Jurors return to courtroom.  Court reads jury instructions to jurors.  Closing argument by DA Laspisa.  Closing argument by Atty Kapelis.  Rebuttal by DA Laspisa.  Court reads final jury instructions to jurors.  Alternate juror selected.  Bailiffs sworn.  Jurors retired to jury room for deliberations.  Court statement to alternate juror.  Court recess 3:56 p.m.  Court reconvenes 4:19 p.m.  Same appearances.  Jurors return to courtroom.  Court reads verdicts:  Count 1 - Guilty; Count 2 - Guilty; Count 3 - Guilty; Count 4 - Guilty; Count 5 - Guilty.  Court polls each juror regarding his/her verdict.  Court statement to jurors.  Jurors released.  DA Laspisa moves for judgment on verdict.  No objection.  Court adjudicates defendant guilty per verdicts submitted by jury.  Statement by DA Laspisa re PSI.  Atty Kapelis has not had discussion of PSI with defendant.  Court adjourned 4:24 p.m. 

Court sets all cases (22CF37, 22CF152, 22CF174) for Status Hearing on November 15th at 1:45 p.m.

Defendant ALFONSO LOPEZ in court.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis in court for ALFONSO LOPEZ.  Atty Kapelis states they are still going forward to Jury trial. DA Laspisa requests to proceed first on 2022CF37. Atty Kapelis does not have any objection to the felony being tried first. Statement by DA - has not viewed defense motions but will look at them. 

Court sets 2022CF37 for Jury Trial on October 11, 2022 at 8:15 AM and Jury Status Hearing on September 20, 2022 at 1:15 PM. 2021CM217 is to track with the felony. Statement by Atty Kapelis - has an issue with one of the State's motion in limine. Statement by the Court. Statement by DA Laspisa. Statement by Atty Kapelis. Statement by the Court.

NOT ON THE RECORD 

Defendant ALFONSO LOPEZ in court. Attorney Michael J Kapelis in court for ALFONSO LOPEZ. Attorney Matthew McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Kapelis states the defendant is requesting a jury trial on both cases. Court sets both cases for Status Hearing on July 12, 2022 at 3:45 PM. Motions and witness lists to be filed the day before.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 31, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

Return date on May 2, 2022 at 10:30 am.

11:19 AM Defendant ALFONSO LOPEZ in court, in custody.  Attorney Matt McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis in court for ALFONSO LOPEZ. Atty Kapelis states the defendant is waiving his right to a prelim. Def concurs. Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination. Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary examination. Court finds probable cause. Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files an information with the court, same as criminal complaint and copy emailed to Atty Kapelis. Attorney Kapelis acknowledges receipt of the information and waives any reading. Atty Kapelis enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant. Atty Kapelis confirms it mirrors the criminal complaint. 

Court notes there is a motion to modify bond on file. Statement by Atty Kapelis regarding bond. ADA McElroy makes statement regarding bond. Statement by the Court - denies motion to modify bond. Court will set for Return Date on May 2, 2022 at 10:30 AM.

Court adjourned at 11:24.
Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver on March 29, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver on April 5, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Second appearance on April 5, 2022 at 11:15 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
9:43 AM Defendant ALFONSO LOPEZ appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant has no objection to holding this hearing by zoom. Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney. Court notes bond has been set. DA Laspisa states the victim may be present in court today. Nobody addresses the Court. Defendant requests bond reduction. Court continues bond as is. Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant waives the time limits. Court will set for Status of Counsel April 05, 2022 at 11:15 AM.

Court adjourned at 9:45 AM.

Defendant Alfonso Lopez appeared in custody, by video, Attorney Gerise Laspisa appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. PC Statement was received and reviewed by the Court. DA Laspisa goes over def's criminal history and confirms compliance with victim witness rights. DA Laspisa makes bond recommendation. Court orders bond at $2500 cash bond and conditions of: No Contact with the mother of his children. Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.
